Experiment

Description

Default class defining an experiment. An experiment object can contain multiple subjects, which themselves can contain multiple sequences.

Initialisation

class classes.experiment.Experiment(name=None)

Creates and return an Experiment object. An Experiment object can contain multiple Subject instances, which in turn contain Sequence instances.

New in version 2.0.

Parameters:

name (str, optional) – The name of the experiment.

name

The name of the experiment.

Type:

str or None

subjects

A list of Subject instances.

Type:

list(Subject)

Setter functions

Experiment.set_name(name)

Sets the attribute Experiment.name of the Experiment instance.

New in version 2.0.

Parameters:

name (str) – The name of the experiment.

Subject functions

Experiment.add_subject(subject)

Adds a Subject instance to the subject.

New in version 2.0.

Parameters:

subject (Subject) – A Subject instance.

Experiment.get_subjects()

Returns the attribute subjects of the Experiment instance.

New in version 2.0.

Returns:

A list of Subject instances.

Return type:

list(Subject)

Experiment.get_subjects_names()

Returns a list containing the attributes subject.Subject.name for each subject.

New in version 2.0.

Returns:

A list of all the subjects names.

Return type:

list(str)

Experiment.get_subject_from_index(subject_index)

Returns the Subject instance matching the given index.

New in version 2.0.

Parameters:

subject_index (int) – The index of the subject.

Returns:

A Subject instance corresponding to the provided index.

Return type:

Subject

Experiment.get_subject_from_name(subject_name)

Returns the first Subject instance in subjects having the attribute subject.Subject.name matching the name provided as parameter.

New in version 2.0.

Parameters:

subject_name (str) – The name attribute of a Subject instance.

Returns:

A Subject instance having the provided name as it attribute subject.Subject.name.

Return type:

Subject

Experiment.remove_subject_from_index(subject_index)

Removes a subject from the Experiment instance corresponding to the given index.

New in version 2.0.

Parameters:

subject_index (int) – The index of the subject to remove.

Experiment.remove_subject_from_name(subject_name)

Removes the first Subject instance in subjects having the attribute subject.Subject.name matching the name provided as parameter.

New in version 2.0.

Parameters:

subject_name (str) – The name attribute of a Subject instance.

Experiment.get_subjects_from_group(group)

Returns a list of all the subjects that have an attribute subject.Subject.group equal to the condition provided.

New in version 2.0.

Parameters:

group (str) – An subject group.

Returns:

A list of Subject instances.

Return type:

list(Subject)

Experiment.get_subjects_from_attribute(attribute, value)

Returns a list of all the subjects that have a provided attribute equal to a provided value.

New in version 2.0.

Parameters:

  • attribute (str) – The name of the Subject attribute to compare to the value.

  • value (any) – The value to match to each Subject’s provided attribute.

Experiment.get_number_of_subjects()

Returns the length of the subjects attribute.

New in version 2.0.

Returns:

The length of the subjects attribute.

Return type:

int

Getter functions

Experiment.get_name()

Returns the attribute name of the Experiment instance.

New in version 2.0.

Returns:

The name of the experiment.

Return type:

str
